


#Loading the libraries 
```{r}
library(tm)
library(readxl)
library(NLP)
```

#Loading the data in
```{r}
library(readr)
worksheet <- read_csv("~/userswithcancerintheirDescription.csv", 
    col_types = cols(Id = col_character()))
View(worksheet)
worksheet$X1 = NULL
```


#Create the corpus
```{r}

tweets_corpus = Corpus(VectorSource(worksheet$Description))
tweet_corpus = Corpus(VectorSource(worksheet$Description))


inspect(tweet_corpus[1])



```


#Prints out the stopwords and checks them
```{r}

print(stopwords("en"))
"supporting" %in% stopwords("en")

"many" %in% stopwords("en")
"get" %in% stopwords("en")
"hutch" %in% stopwords("en")
"can" %in% stopwords("en") 

```




#cleaning and stemming the corpus and checking it 

```{r}
tweets_corpus= tm_map(tweets_corpus, removeNumbers)
tweets_corpus= tm_map(tweets_corpus, removePunctuation)
tweets_corpus= tm_map(tweets_corpus, content_transformer(tolower))
tweets_corpus= tm_map(tweets_corpus, removeWords, c("the", "cancer", "and", stopwords("english")))
tweets_corpus=  tm_map(tweets_corpus, stripWhitespace)


inspect(tweets_corpus[1])
inspect(tweet_corpus[1])


```

tweets_dtm

#Word frequency
```{r}

tdm <- TermDocumentMatrix(tweets_corpus)


#gets rid of empty cells 
ui = unique(tdm$i)
tdm.new = tdm[ui,]
any(tdm.new==0)
allmisscols <- apply(tdm.new,2, function(x)all(is.na(x)));  
colswithallmiss <-names(allmisscols[allmisscols>0]);    
print("the columns with all values missing");    
print(colswithallmiss);


#lets us see the frequency of the words 
m <- as.matrix(tdm.new)
v <- sort(rowSums(m), decreasing = TRUE)
d <- data.frame(word = names(v), freq=v)
rownames(d) <- NULL
head(d,10)



"cancer" %in% peoplewithcancerindescription
'cancer' %in% peoplewithcancerindescription$Description

```
